explains: adj. 暴躁的；古怪的；动摇的

sentences.en: Vegetarianism has shed its cranky image.
sentences.cn: 素食主义已经摆脱了其古怪的形象。

sentences.en: Who can blame them for being cranky?
Thanks to an exhausted and cranky state, for which there is no prospect of dramatic reform, much of the job of development will fall upon the private sector.
sentences.cn: 由于疲惫和暴躁的状态，并无大幅改革的前景，大部分的工作将落在私人部门的发展。
